Description: Air Liquide settled a case in which it was charged with releasing ozone-depleting gases from industrial process refrigeration systems at 22 facilities in 18 states. It agreed convert its industrial refrigeration systems to systems using alternative, environmentally friendly refrigerants. The company also agreed to fund an environmental justice supplemental project and pay a $4.5 million civil penalty.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).

Description: Airgas Doral, Inc. was sentenced to a $4,300,000 criminal fine, two years organizational probation, with a special condition of a hazardous materials compliance program, including an independent monitor and periodic reporting, and was ordered to pay a total of $2,700,000 in restitution to the estates of the three stevedores who died from asphyxiation on May 20, 2008, as a result their exposure to argon gas in the hold of a cargo vessel at Port Everglades.
